question_stem.en: A 65-year-old man is brought to the emergency department due to an acute change in mental status. The patient was having dinner with his family when he suddenly had difficulty using his fork and appeared confused. Other medical conditions include type 2 diabetes mellitus, hyperlipidemia, and hypertension. The patient is a high school calculus teacher and has a 40-pack-year smoking history. Blood pressure is 180/98 mm Hg and pulse is 98/min and regular. On physical examination, the patient is well oriented, answers questions appropriately, and has no motor, sensory, or visual deficits. He is unable to add simple numbers such as 17 plus 9; he is also unable to recognize or distinguish his fingers. {{exhibit_1}} {{exhibit_2}} {{exhibit_3}}
question_stem.zh: 一名65岁男性因精神状态突发改变被送往急诊科。患者与家人共进晚餐时，突然出现使用叉子的困难，并表现出意识模糊。其他疾病包括2型糖尿病、高脂血症和高血压。患者是一名高中微积分老师，有40包年的吸烟史。血压为180/98 mm Hg，脉搏98次/分钟且规律。体格检查显示，患者定向力好，能适当回答问题，且无运动、感觉或视觉缺陷。他无法进行简单的加法计算，例如17加9；他也无法识别或区分自己的手指。{{exhibit_1}} {{exhibit_2}} {{exhibit_3}}

question.en: Which of the following brain areas is most likely affected in this patient?
question.zh: 该患者最有可能受到影响的脑区是以下哪一项？

explanation.en:
This patient has had a stroke but has no motor, sensory, or visual deficits. However, he has trouble eating, solving simple mathematical problems (despite being a calculus teacher), and identifying his fingers, which are all tasks requiring MULTISENSORY INTEGRATION (eg, visual-spatial, tactile, proprioceptive). The PARIETAL ASSOCIATION CORTEX is the brain region responsible for processing this information, and facilitates comprehension (eg, understanding words & symbols) and problem solving (eg, numerical calculation, spatial orientation).

This patient's particular pattern of deficits is suggestive of injury involving the ANGULAR GYRUS of the LEFT (dominant) parietal lobe. Damage to this region classically results in GERSTMANN SYNDROME, which is characterized by the following signs:

* Agraphia (inability to write)
* Acalculia (inability to solve mathematical calculations)
* Finger agnosia (inability to identify individual fingers on the hand)
* Left-right disorientation

Although Gerstmann syndrome may occur as an isolated syndrome, lesions to the angular gyrus may also be associated with alexia (inability to read) and aphasia (impaired speech), also tasks that require multisensory integration.

(Choice A) This area just anterior to the central sulcus is the precentral gyrus (primary motor cortex). Lesions to this area would result in contralateral weakness according to the somatotopic organization of the brain.

(Choice B) This area posterior to the central sulcus is the postcentral gyrus (parietal somatosensory cortex). A lesion here would cause sensation loss in the contralateral body.

(Choice C) This location in the caudal part of the inferior frontal gyrus of the dominant hemisphere is Broca area. A stroke in this area leads to an expressive aphasia. Although patients with expressive aphasia may have difficulty writing, speech would also be impacted (usually characterized by nonfluent speech).

(Choice E) A lesion to the visual cortex, located in the occipital lobe, can lead to cortical blindness or visual impairment.

Educational objective:
Because the parietal association cortex integrates multisensory information, damage can lead to difficulties in comprehension and problem-solving in the absence of motor or sensory deficits. Specific injury to the angular gyrus classically results in Gerstmann syndrome (agraphia, acalculia, finger agnosia, and left-right disorientation).
explanation.zh:
该患者患有卒中，但没有运动、感觉或视觉缺陷。然而，他进食困难，无法解决简单的数学问题（尽管是一名微积分老师），也无法识别自己的手指，所有这些都是需要多感官整合（例如，视觉-空间、触觉、本体感觉）的任务。顶叶联合皮层是负责处理这些信息的脑区，并有助于理解（例如，理解单词和符号）和解决问题（例如，数字计算、空间定向）。

该患者的特定缺陷模式提示损伤累及左侧（优势半球）顶叶的角回。该区域的损伤通常会导致格斯特曼综合征，其特征是以下体征：

* 失写症（无法书写）
* 计算不能（无法解决数学计算）
* 手指失认症（无法识别手上的各个手指）
* 左右定向障碍

尽管格斯特曼综合征可能作为一种孤立的综合征出现，但角回的病变也可能与失读症（无法阅读）和失语症（言语障碍）相关，这些也是需要多感官整合的任务。

（选项A）中央沟前方的这个区域是中央前回（初级运动皮层）。根据大脑的躯体定位组织，该区域的病变会导致对侧无力。

（选项B）中央沟后方的这个区域是中央后回（顶叶体感觉皮层）。此处的病变会导致对侧身体的感觉丧失。

（选项C）优势半球下额回后部的这个位置是Broca区。该区域的卒中会导致表达性失语症。尽管表达性失语症患者可能难以书写，但言语也会受到影响（通常表现为非流畅性言语）。

（选项E）枕叶的视觉皮层的病变可导致皮质性失明或视觉障碍。

教育目标：
由于顶叶联合皮层整合多感官信息，损伤可导致理解和解决问题的困难，而没有运动或感觉缺陷。角回的特异性损伤通常会导致格斯特曼综合征（失写症、计算不能、手指失认症和左右定向障碍）。

summary.en:
This question tests the understanding of the neurological localization of specific cognitive deficits, particularly those associated with damage to the parietal lobe and the resulting Gerstmann syndrome. It requires correlating clinical symptoms with specific brain regions responsible for complex cognitive functions.

To solve this question, one must identify the constellation of symptoms (acalculia, finger agnosia, difficulty with complex tasks despite intact primary motor/sensory function) and link them to the characteristic deficits of Gerstmann syndrome. Knowledge of the functional anatomy of the brain, specifically the role of the angular gyrus in multisensory integration and higher-order cognition, is crucial.
summary.zh:
此问题测试对特定认知缺陷的神经学定位的理解，特别是那些与顶叶损伤和由此产生的格斯特曼综合征相关的缺陷。它需要将临床症状与负责复杂认知功能的特定脑区相关联。

要解决此问题，必须识别症状组合（计算不能、手指失认症、尽管初级运动/感觉功能完好但仍难以完成复杂任务），并将它们与格斯特曼综合征的特征性缺陷联系起来。了解大脑的功能解剖，特别是角回在多感官整合和高级认知中的作用，至关重要。
